thread.title: Rex Ryan 'not comfortable' saying Tyrod Taylor will play for Bills against Bengals (5 injury notes)
thread.title_full: Rex Ryan 'not comfortable' saying Tyrod Taylor will play for Bills against Bengals (5 injury notes) | syracuse.com

author: Matthew Fairburn | mfairburn@syracuse.com
title: Rex Ryan 'not comfortable' saying Tyrod Taylor will play for Bills against Bengals (5 injury notes)
text:
Orchard Park, N.Y. â€” The guessing game that is the Buffalo Bills' Week 6 injury report continued Thursday, as key offensive players quarterback Tyrod Taylor, running back LeSean McCoy and wide receiver Sammy Watkins were all among those limited in practice Wednesday.
Taylor is the name causing the most concern. Bills coach Rex Ryan said EJ Manuel again took the majority of first-team reps at practice for the Bills, but that Taylor has been progressing.
"Tyrod is doing good," Ryan said Thursday. "He's progressively getting a little bit better. But I'm not comfortable saying that he would definitely be the guy, yet."
Taylor said Wednesday he would like to know by Friday whether he's playing, so stay tuned for that. Here are the other injury items of notes from Wednesday.
1. LeSean McCoy closer McCoy was listed as limited on the injury report, and the Bills still haven't added another running back after Cierre Wood went on injured reserve. Ryan said Thursday the Bills could use fullback Jerome Felton if they needed another running back. Still, Ryan was non-committal on the running back.
"He's a lot better this week than he was last week," Ryan said. "I think he's definitely progressing, so we'll let the week play out and see how he looks."
2. Rex won't let Watkins make the call On Wednesday, wide receiver Sammy Watkins all but confirmed he would push through his calf injury in Week 6 because the Bills' offense has been "basic" without him. On re-injury, Watkins said, "if it pops, it pops." Ryan said he wouldn't let Watkins make that call.
"Yeah, we'll make sure that it won't be his decision, obviously, if that's what he's saying," Ryan said. "We're gonna make sure that ... we'll lean on the experts."
3. No Karlos Williams update Rookie running back Karlos Williams, who scored touchdowns in each of his first four games, still was not at practice Thursday. He hasn't practiced since he suffered a concussion against the Giants, and Ryan said Thursday he isn't sure if he's in the building or whether he has made any progress in terms of the concussion protocol.
4. The safety position With the Bills placing Aaron Williams on injured reserve, they have a hole to fill at safety. Bacarri Rambo is dealing with a quad injury but was a full participant in practice Thursday. He and Duke Williams could both be in line for snaps in Williams' place, but defensive coordinator Dennis Thurman said the team hasn't made a decision on who will start.
5. Full practice report Did not participate:
Marcus Easley, wide receiver (shoulder)
Karlos Williams, running back (concussion)
Limited participation:
Sammy Watkins, wide receiver (calf)
Charles Clay, tight end (calf)
Marcell Dareus, defensive tackle (hip)
LeSean McCoy, running bacl (hamstring)
Randell Johnson, linebacker (hand)
Tyrod Taylor, quarterback (knee)
Cordy Glenn, offensive tackle (ankle)
John Miller, guard (groin)
Chris Hogan, wide receiver (hamstring)
Full participation:
Ron Brooks, cornerback (thumb)
Cyrus Kouandjio, offensive tackle (knee)
Percy Harvin, wide receiver (hip)
Bacarri Rambo, safety (quad)
